content:
Emails are not in the Trash folder.

Opening up the Inbox MBOX file directly, I can see that these 400 emails were never actually downloaded into this file. Not sure what happened.

Opening up my remote email host, I can see that those 400 emails are still there, to the exact point when I last closed Thunderbird.

Asking Thunderbird to download new messages does not download these remote emails.

How do I reset Thunderbird to start the process over and re-download these emails again? Part of TB seems to think it's already downloaded these emails, while another part of TB never actually did.
creator: misc32

content:
Unfortunately I find Optus has not improved since I closed my account over 20 years ago, I felt they offered sub par products heavily advertised and poorly supported. That continues today as I can't find anything useful on the Optus web site about their mail settings.

The mailbird application have settings on their support site that hopefully will work for you. optusnet.com.au SMTP

Server mail.optusnet.com.au SMTP Port 465 SMTP Security SSL SMTP Username your-email@optusnet.com.au SMTP Password Your optusnet.com.au password

You do not mention what setting you are currently using, but I think I recall historically optus using port 25 to send mail. Something that was sort of frowned on for the last 20 years, so you might want to start there.

Note your outgoing server (SMTP) settings are in account settings and are not a part of your incoming account.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: If this is an IMAP account, highlight the acccount on main screen, rightclick and click 'subscribe' and see if you can untick the folders.
